Article/0-0-0-18/getting-started.title: Getting Started
Article/0-0-0-18/getting-started.html:
ðŸ“Œ You can watch a video tutorial on our Youtube Channel<\/a>.<\/p> <\/blockquote>

Create full stack JavaScript applications within seconds using npx<\/code> to generate your project files from the latest template.<\/p>

ðŸ”¥ The minimum required node.js<\/a> version for development mode is 12.20.0<\/em>.<\/p> <\/blockquote>

Replace project-name<\/code> with your project name and run the command below to start a project:<\/p> 

npx create-<\/span>nullstack-<\/span>app@latest project-<\/span>name
<\/code><\/pre>



ðŸ’¡ You can use a CLI to select the blank javascript or typescript template or select the template with tailwind css.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Change directory to the generated folder:<\/p>

cd project-<\/span>name
<\/code><\/pre>

Install the dependencies:<\/p>

npm install # or yarn
<\/code><\/pre>

Start the application in development mode:<\/p>

npm start # or yarn start
<\/code><\/pre>

Understanding the generated files<\/a><\/h2>
The following folders and files will be generated:<\/p>

server.js<\/a><\/h3>
This is the server entry and generator point.<\/p>

It is a convenient place to set up global things like database<\/a> and manipulate server context<\/code>, details in application startup<\/a>.<\/p>

client.js<\/a><\/h3>
This is the client entry and generator point.<\/p>

It is a convenient place to import global dependencies like CSS frameworks and manipulate client context<\/code>.<\/p>

src/<\/a><\/h3>
This folder will contain the actual source code of your application.<\/p>

src/Application.jsx<\/a><\/h3>
This is your application main file.<\/p>



âœ¨ Learn more about the jsx elements<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

When you run npm start<\/code> it is consumed in server<\/strong>/client<\/strong> JS files by their Nullstack.start<\/code> function, which starts and returns both context<\/code><\/a>, that you can use to set up things like database<\/a> using settings<\/a> and secrets<\/a>.<\/p>



âœ¨ Learn more about the application startup<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

TypeScript<\/a><\/h4>
You can use Nullstack with TypeScript, just rename njs<\/code> to nts<\/code> or jsx<\/code> to tsx<\/code>.<\/p>

src/Application.css<\/a><\/h3>
This is an empty file just to demonstrate that you can use CSS with Nullstack<\/a>.<\/p>

It is a good practice to import a style file in a component with the same name.<\/p>



âœ¨ Learn more about styles<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

public/<\/a><\/h3>
Every file in here will be available to anyone from the domain root.<\/p>

By default create-nullstack-app<\/code> generates the icons required for your manifest.json<\/strong> and images for OG meta tags.<\/p>



âœ¨ Learn more about manifest.json<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

Be sure to replace these images with your project identity.<\/p>

.development/<\/a><\/h3>
This is the compiled result of your application in development mode.<\/p>



ðŸ”¥ Do not touch this folder<\/p>
<\/blockquote>

.production/<\/a><\/h3>
This is the compiled result of your application in production mode.<\/p>



ðŸ”¥ Do not touch this folder<\/p>
<\/blockquote>



âœ¨ Learn more about how to deploy a Nullstack application<\/a>.<\/p>
<\/blockquote>
